page.title: 06THE LIFE OF THE VICAR
page.content: The vicar has been in Shebbear for 14 years. He has three or four services on a Sunday. He is in charge of Shebbear, Langtree, Buckland Filleigh, Newton st. Petrock and Sheepwash. On a Sunday he takes Holy Communion and Morning Prayer. He became a priest because he felt God was calling him. He also is a special constable and spends about 10 hours a month mostly in a police car. The parish that takes up most of his time is Shebbear. In 1984 he had 3 weddings, 3 funerals, and 5 baptisms. He has 4 lay readers to help him preach. The average congregation on a Sunday is 25-30 people. The church that has the biggest congregation is Shebbear. He has to visit people, keep the church clock going, look up records, and take meetings.
